data.title: Robert Lowry (1660-abt.1729)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Robert Lowry born 1660 Aghenis, County Tyrone,  Ireland died 1729 Aghenis, County Tyrone, Ireland including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 13 May 2024 | Created 1 Jun 2014

This page has been accessed 1,010 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Siblings

1.2 Children of Robert Lowry and Anna Sinclair

1.3 Extracts from Will of Robert Lowry, dated 1729

2 Research Notes

3 Sources

Biography

Robert Lowry, the (only surviving) son of John Lowry of Aghenis[1] and Mary Buchanan, was born at Aghenis, parish of Aghaloo, county Tyrone, Ireland.

Siblings

John Lowry; included in the Act of Attainder of 1689

Jane (aka Janet); married John M'Clintock (one of their son's Alexander.)

Anne; married Robert M'Clintock

Rebekah; married William Moore

Catherine; married Samuel Kerry

Robert Lowry of Aghenis, was Commissioner for Escheated Land in counties Tyrone and Armagh and was the purchaser of Fynagh.[2]

Robert Lowry married Anna Sinclair in 1698. Anna was the daughter of the Rev James Sinclair from Hollyhill near Strabane and his wife Anna Galbraith, daughter of Colonel James Calbraith, MP for Strabane. Rev James Sinclair was also Rector of Leckpatrick, the parish of Ballymagory where his grandfather had lived, was situate.[3]

Children of Robert Lowry and Anna Sinclair

John Lowry, b. 22 February, 1699; died unmarried in 1724

Mary Lowry, b. 22 Apr 1701; married Mr. Daniel Eccles

Robert Lowry, b. 03 Feb 1702; M.P. for Strabane; who lived at Melbury (Loughmacnab) near Caledon, and died in 1764, leaving no children. Robert, of Melbury, in the county of Donegall, M.P. married (1) Katherine Dopping and (2) Margaret, daughter of the venerable Archdeacon Hamilton.

Anna Lowry, b. 9 Jun 1704

Galbraith Lowry, b. 9 Jul 1706; married Sarah, second daughter and co heir of Colonel John Corry esq. of Castle Coole, county Fermanagh. Galbraith, of Ahenis, thrice elected knight of the shire for Tyrone. Children: a daughter, Anne, the wife of William Willoughby Cole, Lord Enniskillen; a son and heir, Armar Lowry, esq. of Ahenis, who assumed the additional surname of Corry, and was raised to the peerage as Earl of Belmore. His son is the present Earl . (See BURKE'S Peerage and Baronetage)

Elizabeth Lowry, b. 29 Jul 1708

James Lowry, b. 06 Jul 1711; became a Reverend, he was Rector of Clogherny and later Desertcreat; ancestor of the Lowrys of Pomeroy and Rockdale.[4]

Isabella Lowry, b. 19 Mar 1712

Robert and his brother John, as well as their father (also named John) were included in the Act of Attainder of 1689 ; and in 1692 he was one of the Commissioners of escheated lands for the counties of Tyrone and Armagh. In 1693 he took a lease from May 1st for thirty- one years (if the lease's title should so long continue) from George and John Warburton of Dublin, of the lands of Killygivin and Tullynecalgan in the barony of Dungannon; £6 a year was to be the rent for the first ten years, £8 for the second, and £12 for the remainder of the term. This property he was enabled to purchase out in 1697 for £100* In March 1700 - 1 he purchased from John Hamilton, esq., of Caledon, the townland of Aghenis, near Caledon, together with about eight acres in Loughmacnab, for £450, subject to a quit rent of £? 18s. 6jd. Mr. John Hamilton was second cousin once removed to Mr. Lowry's wife, and the father of Margaret Countess of Orrery, who carried the Caledon property into the Cork and Orrery family*

The following entries in an old Bible, published in London and "printed by John Field, one of His High nesses' Printers, 1658," The entries which follow are in the handwriting of Robert Lowry the elder, the husband of Anna Sinclair. John Lowry was born the 22nd February, 1699, at 5 o'clock in the morning, being Thursday. Mary Lowry was born on Tuesday, the 22nd day of Aprill, 1701, at twelve o'clock at night. Robert Lowry was borne the third day of Feby., 1702,* being Wednesday, at twelve o'cloke at night. Anna Lowry was borne ye nth day of June, 1704, about 3 a clock in the morning, being Sunday. Galbraith Lowry was borne the nth day of Jully, about five a cloke in the morning, being Thursday, and in the yeare 1706. Eliz Lowry was borne on Thursday, the 29th Jully, 1708, about 12a cloke on the said day. James Lowry was borne on Friday the 6th day of Jully, 1711, about eight a clock at night. Isabella Lowry was borne on the 19th day of March, 1712, about 4 a clocke in ye afternoon.

Robert died at Ahenis, County Tyrone 1729.

His will was dated 1729, and he must have died shortly afterwards (as his son Galbraith says), at home (Aghenis) of the dropsie. He disposed of his property in the following manner :

Extracts from Will of Robert Lowry, dated 1729

The manor of Sixmilecross having been settled at the marriage of his eldest son Robert with Katherine Dopping, he leaves him only a legacy of £20. He bequeathed in trust to his son-in-law Daniel Eccles, and to Alexander M'Clintock as executors, the town and lands of (Aghenis) Ballyboy, and about eight acres in the townland of Loughmacnab, Killygivan, Tullyancolgan, Lissaaggan, Kiladery, Legacorry, Beagh, Letterfearne, Arvallee, Edenderry, the tuck mill and corn mill, Garvaghlees, Aghagallon, Mullagh, Cranny, Drumgrane, Taltymulmoney, Benefarga, Hallaghan, Hillinana, Cormackellagher, Lisneadin, Backarrenbeg, Tullyenagh, and Oorne- brecken, to his second surviving son Galbraith Lowry for his life, with remainder to his heirs male. Failing them to his third surviving son James Lowry and his heirs male, and failing James to Robert, failing male issue of the three sons to the eldest daughter of Galbraith and her heirs male, failing her to her sisters in succession, and their heirs male. Their husbands to take the surname and arms of Lowry. Failing Galbraith's daughters to James's daughters under like condition. To James Lowry his third son for life, and his heirs male, the manor townlands and ballyboes in Altadesart otherwise Chichester, lying and being in the barony of Dungannon. Failing James to Galbraith and his heirs male ; failing him to Robert and his heirs male. To Galbraith, when seized of the aforesaid lands, he gave power to charge them with a jointure not exceeding £200 per annum ; and a further power to Galbraith to charge them with a sum not exceeding £2,000 for daughters and younger sons, or daughters if no son. James also was to have power to charge his lands with £1,000. To his daughter Isabella he bequeathed £100, to be paid at the age of eighteen or day of marriage, and if she married with consent of his executors £1,500. In case of her demise before eighteen and unmarried, or if she married without consent, Galbraith was to take the £1,500. Isabella was to get £50 per annum from testator's death until marriage in lieu of interest. To M'Clintock he left £100, and further to Galbraith the sum of £2,000 due by D. Eccles. To his sisters Jane and Anne M'Clintock, and brothers-in-law Perry and Moore, the sum of £80 to be divided equally. If any part of the personalty was remaining after legacies were paid, James was to have £100, and Galbraith to be sole executor and residuary legatee. In a codicil he revoked the bequest of £1,600 to Isabella, and gave her £1,000 ; to his sister, Jane M'Clintock, £40 ; his sister, Catherine Perry, of Mullaghmore, £40 ; to his sister Anne M'Clintock, £40 ; to the children of his sister Rebekah Moore, £40 ; to his daughter Mary Eccles, £40. The sum of £600 taken from Isabella was to discharge these latter legacies.[5]

Research Notes

The Bob Lowery List (do not delete)

An excerpt from an Old list compiled by Bob Lowery. Bob was in search of Lazarus Lowry's parents. He shared this list with all Lowry families and asked that it not be sold. He is since deceased. This information extracted from that list correlates to this particular family.

Note: first entry here is Anne Sinclair b 1676 Relation only to John Lowry second entry a Robert b. 1670 also a relation only to John Lowry. The only Robert Lowry on the list who's father is John Lowry was born in 1660. It is the 3rd entry. It seems to be the proper date of birth for the man married to Anna Sinclair because it states mother is Mary Buchanan as does the biography on Robert and that the other Robert born 1670 was perhaps a cousin. However if the marriage date is correct for Anna and Robert, then John is not the father, but probably the Cousin.

ROBERT LOWRY(M) BORN 1660 FATHER: JOHN LOWRY MOTHER: MARY BUCHANAN AHENIS, TYRONE, IRELAND LDSB:PRE 1970F#: 471029 @...E: PRE 1970...SP:8 JUN 1966 SLAKE Robert Lowry

ROBERT LOWRY(M) BORN 1670 REL:JOHN LOWRY , (NO PARENTS LISTED) TYRONE, IRELAND LDSB:2 MAY 1911 MANTIF#: 170398 @...E: PRE 1970P#: 256...SP: PRE 1970
